message.body: did you see Kiper called Newton an Akili Smith One-Year Wonder?
just went invis for the afternoon
needed to get some work done
couldn't be bothered by all the ho's trying to get with me
Gil Brandt said last night he would take Cam 1st overall
i will buy that over kiper
not that he is end all be all
I think he is getting a little soft in his old age
tell you what though, if there is a rookie scale in place, i'd be more willing to do it
but man a franchise QB is worth that risk
still--I think you knew Bradford would at least be decent to adequate--same with Stafford
is he McNair and McNabb (neither super accurate)
I don't question cams skills as much his head
but he did just win 2 NC in a row
but that has to count for soemthing
but Ken Dorsey also won a NC and lost another one
i'm not against Cam really--his dad is annoying, he seems like a stupid kid in some ways...but as long as he doesn't go to the Cowboys, I can root for him
I'd just be terrified of taking him #1...in good and bad way
cause man could he pay off in a HUGE way
im not 100% sold on him either
I really don't have a problem witht eh entertainer and icon thing though
and to me he comes off a little sleezy
but man he does haev a winning smile
i put the icon thing on PK--PK annoys the shit out of me these days
I still read PK, but I'm off him
I am down on him big time
it used to be him just reporting the facts and what he witnessed
and you have tin find the facts in therere
I guess it is that NBC influence
you know what is the dumbest story every--the PFT one about McElroy's Wonderlic score being so high that it could turn-off coaches
I cannot wait for this draft
seriously--I can't wait for the Eagles to trade out of the first round and take some 5'10 Linebacker that sucks

Ohio State could have easily terminated Tressel under the terms of his contract.
Instead, OSU's message was clear: Keep beating Michigan and winning Big Ten championships, and we've got your back.
For the record, Michigan's football team hasn't beaten Ohio State in 2,663 days.
But the Wolverines won on Tuesday.
At least they had fired their cheating coach.
so for a 1st and 3rd...who do you want? Palmer or Kolb?
those are the terms...and you have to pick one
the third can be from 2012 since you don't have one this year
you'd take Jordan Palmer--you idiot! I totally fooled you
I just screwed Seattle for a long time
I have no clue with Kolb
read a point against him by Brock Huard this morning
not that I put a huge amount of stock in his opinion
there's a guy who knows how to play QB poorly too
Brock is really good on radio and ESPN games
have to give him a chance then
you have prbably watched games that he did and didn't know
he did a lot of games last year
bring a real technical analysis to the booth, whcih I like
what's the name of that jersey discount place?
i find a couple of things there to argue with
1. He lost his job this year due to injury
but if he was that good would he have not regained it?
interesting that you say that because as i was saying I'd go back to Kolb, I remember you saying that Vick was playing so well how could you bench him
so if people say Vick was unconscious
then how can you fault Kolb for that?
because I dont think Kolb is that good
if Kolb is worthy of a #1 pick
2. when he came back and played in 3 games...he was great in 2 of them
and I don't have a problem with him not beating about DNabb...DNabb is the greatest QB in Eagles franchise history
andn played great even in his last year with the Eagles
so is Kolb a sure thing -- no, but I disagree with some of those statements cause I think they are too black-and-white when there is a lot more gray about Kolb
I see Kolb and matt schaub as the same player right now
Ryan Fitzpatrick had some SICK games last year
i'd say that is the market (starting point) then if I'm the Eagles GM
might change as you see what teams are offering
but that is a very similar player in a bunch of ways
what's your thinking on the Fitzy point?
just that Kolb had some really good games, but overall hasn't been crazy impressive
he has had some really good games, but overall I am not going to give the franchise to him
just in reference to the 2 out 3 games were really good
I'd also say the last game against the Cowboys is a tough way to see him in the final game...the Eagles played 2 starters on offense...none at skill positions
and DeMarcus Ware ate Austin Howard and King Dunlap for bkfast, lunch, and dinner
I'd say I would throw out a lot of that game in terms of evaluating him
then throw out the good game
i'd look at the Packers game up to the injury
no team really had much to scout on
the titans game when he really struggled
Vick and Kolb are both FAs this offseason and you can only sign one
take pieces from teh Cowboys game, but I don't think it is bad to say that you have to eval the tape from that game in context of eagles 2nd string versus Cowgirls 1st string
i'd sign Vick right now for 3 years (but let me explain why)
I would try to trade him
I'd still go with Vick--because our OLine sucks
if he is that good isn't he a long term fix?
Kolb will be 27 going into the season
so I'd say they are similar in age
but probably has a shorter lifespan
vick has taken more hits than any other QB per year
Kolb has probably taken less than 25
yeah, but he had 2 years off dude
right, but now he can retrain his body
oh I love Vick and would chose the same
but if that is your choice - than Kolb aint that good
because if he is worth a top pick in the draft
i don't think my choice has any bearing on whether Kolb is good or not
I think the kid can play
if he was that good you would pick him
that has everything to do with it
i just think Vick is better right now for the Eagles
so if the oline was fixed
if we said Vick is gone, I wouldn't mind having Kolb
and we aren't in that situation anyways
oline will be average at worst
i'd take either as my starting QB
but the Eagles peeps like Vick
i would take Vick for today
I'd take Vick for the next 3 years and Kolb for the next 5
whatever my window is will determine that
okay so those are your contracts
given the small windows in the NFL
sign Vick to a 3 year deal of Kolb to a 5 year deal
because who know if DJax gets hurt
so every team is a win now team
that in my mind devalues Kolb a bit
so he comes of age at 30?
I would not give up a 1st rounder for that
I think Kolb can play tomorrow for an NFL team and do a good job
I think Vick is better right now though
well he was on the Eagles...so his talent was way better
I think Kolb could lead an NFC West team to the playoffs
I think he could do better than Hass last year
I think he could lead the Eagles to the playoffs next year if he was the starter
that was my expectation for this year if Kolb was the starter (2011 meaning)
but I guess this iss trying to findout his real value
I think based on previous moves, his value starts at Schaub's value
but that is the starting point
if you really thought he could potentially be a top 10 QB in the league I don't think you would trade him
but what if you have a top 10 QB on your roster already
you can't make that work long term
I think you only draft QBs in the first round to acheive that
would you rather have a top 10 Qb that is 30 or 27?
and the 30 yr old already has injury problems
I would keep the 27 yr old
so then Reid doesn't see Kolb as a top 10 QB most likely
or a high % chance of him getting there
I don't know what Reid thinks
I am just looking at his decisions
or like a guy in a sweater vest
forget what comes out his mouth and look at the actions
and what I would do if I were the Eagles
I'd say who is the more tradeable asset
and the Eagles have identified that as Kolb because they want to keep Vick
part of that from what I've seen
is because Vick gives them the best chance to win right now
and with something for Kolb they can fix the D and help the OL in a way to win an SB in the next 3 years
after that Reid either has an SB or is done in my mind
because this is his second window
now he needs to add some final (big) pieces
but if you add a few solid on 1-2 good/great players to the D (whether they develop from within, in FA, or draft) and we are a serious contender with our offensive skill
and that is the motivation behind moving Kolb
also could be because Kolb just isn't THAT good
but I do think he can play
I don't think he is alex smith
so what is your realistic expectation of him? would you give up a #1 and #3 if Kolb had a Hass like career moving forward?
Hass had some really good years under an offensive genius
1 &3 is a lot to give up for a QB who was never really a top 10 QB
you could give up a 1 and 3 for roy williams
I have been until my dipshit boss interrupted me
I would much rather face Rutgers
but St. Johns vs Cuse in the Garden is a way better game
take more time off the clock
what the fuck was that ending???
there was 1.7 left on the clock!
so how is the game over?
the dude stepped out of bounds and traveled
yeah I am not arguing that
if that happened to Cuse, I'd go ape-shit
Rutgers shouldn't have drawn up a desperatino play with 4+seconds left
but that is just clear fact
he stepped out of bounds before he traveled
I'm down with those games in NYC
hard to get big name teams to come to the Dome
NYC at the medowlands is A LOT more attractive
dude i just thought of 1 more thing
that st johns guy should've been t'd up for throwing the ball up in the air like that
he did the same thing that Lville cheerleader did
so -- you still can't launch the ball into the stands
they would not T someone up for that
and they are all talking about it
if someone forced him out or somethign I would be more sympathetic
dude, I can't believe you feel that way...i thought that was total crap...1.7 secs is plenty of time for a good play
if it was Cuse--I'd kill those refs
should I get it for willy for draft?
